Submodules#

overkill.cli module#

Console script for overkill.

overkill.overkill module#

Main module. All user interactions to distribute tasks should use this module. See the ClusterCompute for more details on distributing tasks.

class overkill.overkill.ClusterCompute(n_workers: int, master_address: Tuple[str, int])[source]#

Bases: object

The ClusterCompute class acts as the main interface between the Master server and the user. use this class to distribute an array over a cluster of computers given a function.

Parameters

  • n_workers (int) – number of workers to use to distribute (array is distributed evenly accross workers) Not currently implemented

  • master_address (Tuple[str, int]) – A tuple of (ip, port) e.g. (“localhost”, 5555). Use the .get_address() class member of the Master class to get the address

Example

>>> from overkill.overkill import ClusterCompute
>>> cc = ClusterCompute(1, ('127.0.0.1', 63811))
>>> def f(x):
...     return x**2
>>> cc.map(f, [1, 2, 3])
[1, 4, 9]
map(function: Callable, array: List) → Union[None, List][source]#

Distribute array over function using all compute resources

Parameters

  • function (Callable) – Any array with a single argument

  • array (List) – array to distribute e.g. if Array type is List[int] then function should accept an int

Returns

Transformed list if no exception has been raised

Return type

Union[None, List]
